member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.ExcludeStackTraceSnippetFromSqlTimings

member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.IgnoredPaths

member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.RouteBasePath
member.summary: The path under which ALL routes are registered in, defaults to the application root. For example, "~/myDirectory/" would yield "/myDirectory/includes.js" rather than just "/mini-profiler-resources/includes.js" Any setting here should be in APP RELATIVE FORM, e.g. "~/myDirectory/"

member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.CustomUITemplates
member.summary: The path where custom ui elements are stored. If the custom file doesn't exist, the standard resource is used. This setting should be in APP RELATIVE FORM, e.g. "~/App_Data/MiniProfilerUI"
member.remarks: A web server restart is required to reload new files.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.MaxJsonResponseSize
member.summary: Maximum payload size for json responses in bytes defaults to 2097152 characters, which is equivalent to 4 MB of Unicode string data.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Profiling.MiniProfiler.Settings.Storage
member.summary: Understands how to save and load MiniProfilers. Used for caching between when a profiling session ends and results can be fetched to the client, and for showing shared, full-page results.
member.remarks: The normal profiling session life-cycle is as follows: 1) request begins 2) profiler is started 3) normal page/controller/request execution 4) profiler is stopped 5) profiler is cached with 's implementation of 6) request ends 7) page is displayed and profiling results are ajax-fetched down, pulling cached results from 's implementation of
